video_caption: The video opens with a dark blue background featuring abstract shapes and a logo in the top left corner, accompanied by the text "JAKARTA EE" and "Jakarta Persistence Explained" in white. A person wearing a white shirt appears on the right side of the screen, gesturing as they speak. The scene transitions to a new background with a network of connected dots and lines, and the text "INTRODUCTION" appears in the top left corner. The person continues to speak, and a diagram illustrating an API connected to three database icons is displayed. The video then shows the text "Data Control" with three blue buttons labeled "Data Persistence," "Object Mapping," and "C.R.U.D." The person remains on the right side of the screen, gesturing and speaking throughout the video. The background remains consistent with the network of connected dots and lines, and the "JAKARTA EE" logo is visible in the top right corner. The video concludes with the person still speaking and gesturing, with the same background and text elements displayed.

The video features a man in a white shirt standing in front of a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, resembling a digital or technological theme. The text "INTRODUCTION" and the logo "JAKARTA EE" are visible in the top corners. The man appears to be explaining or presenting information related to Jakarta EE, as indicated by the text and logos. The scene transitions to a detailed diagram of the Jakarta EE platform, highlighting the "JAKARTA EE WEB PROFILE" and "JAKARTA EE CORE PROFILE" with various features listed under each. The man continues to speak, likely elaborating on the content displayed. The video then shifts to a coding environment, showing a Java class named "Account" with annotations and methods, alongside a terminal window displaying database table information. The text "MAPPING ENTITIES" is visible, suggesting a focus on mapping Java entities to database tables. The man continues to explain the code and its relation to the database, using hand gestures to emphasize points. The video maintains a consistent technological and educational atmosphere throughout, with the man actively engaging with the audience by explaining the concepts and code displayed on the screen.

The video features a man in a white shirt standing against a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, resembling a digital or technological theme. The text "ENTITY RELATIONSHIPS" appears in the top left corner, accompanied by an orange cloud icon, while the "JAKARTA EE" logo is visible in the top right corner. The man gestures with his hands as he speaks, explaining various concepts related to entity relationships in databases. The background transitions to display diagrams illustrating relational databases, with tables labeled "Table 1," "Table 2," "Table 3," and "Table 4," connected by lines to a central database icon. The man continues to explain, with the background changing to show different diagrams, including one with two tables labeled "Table A" and "Table B," connected to a third table below them. Another diagram shows a network of entities labeled "Person," "Author," "Publisher," and "Book," with arrows indicating relationships such as "OneToOne," "OneToMany," and "ManyToMany." The man uses hand gestures to emphasize his points. The video concludes with the man standing against the blue background, with the text "@OneToMany(mappedBy = "post", cascade = CascadeType.ALL, fetch = FetchType.EAGER, optional = false)" appearing on the screen, indicating a specific annotation related to entity relationships in programming. Throughout the video, the man maintains a professional demeanor, using visual aids to enhance his explanation of complex database concepts.

The video features a man in a white sweater standing in front of a digital background that transitions from a network of interconnected nodes to a dark blue screen with the text 'JAKARTA EE' in orange. The man appears to be explaining concepts related to 'ENTITY RELATIONSHIPS' and 'ENTITY MANAGER,' as indicated by the text on the screen. He gestures with his hands while speaking, emphasizing points about '@GeneratedValue' strategies and 'PersistenceUnit' configurations. The background changes to display code snippets and XML configurations, including 'persistence.xml' and 'AccountService.java,' which are part of the Jakarta EE framework. The man continues to explain these concepts, pointing to the code on the screen. The video concludes with the 'JAKARTA EE' logo on a blue background, reinforcing the branding of the framework.

The video features a man in a white sweater standing in front of a screen displaying code related to the Jakarta EE Entity Manager. He gestures towards the screen, which shows various Java code snippets and method calls, such as 'createNativeQuery' and 'find'. The background is dark with the Jakarta EE logo visible in the top right corner. The man appears to be explaining the code, pointing out specific parts and their functions. The scene transitions to a blue background with the Jakarta EE logo and the text 'Metamodel API' displayed prominently. The man continues to explain, now with a diagram illustrating the relationship between the Metamodel API and the Persistence Unit, indicated by an arrow pointing from the API to the Persistence Unit. The video concludes with the man still in front of the screen, emphasizing the connection between the API and the Persistence Unit, with the background featuring a network of interconnected nodes and lines.

The video features a man in a white sweater standing in front of a digital background with a blue theme, dotted with glowing nodes and lines, suggesting a network or digital interface. The background prominently displays the text "METAMODEL API" in the upper left corner, accompanied by an orange cloud icon, and the "JAKARTA EE" logo in the upper right corner. The man appears to be explaining or presenting information related to the Metamodel API, as indicated by the text and icons on the screen. As the video progresses, additional text and diagrams appear, including "UserID" and "UserName" with corresponding grid icons, and a command-line interface showing a directory structure with annotations and example files. The man gestures with his hands, emphasizing points in his presentation. The video concludes with a transition to a blue background featuring the "JAKARTA EE" logo and the acronym "C.R.U.D." in white, indicating a focus on the Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations in the context of Jakarta EE.

The video features a man in a white shirt standing in front of a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, resembling a digital or technological theme. The background also includes the logos of Jakarta EE and CRUD, with the text "Creating Database Records" appearing in the top left corner. The man is explaining the concept of CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations, as indicated by the text and buttons displayed on the screen. The video transitions to a diagram illustrating the process of creating database records, with the terms "@Entity," "@PersistenceContext," and "create()" connected by arrows, demonstrating the flow of data creation. The man gestures with his hands, emphasizing the points he is making, and the overall atmosphere is educational and informative, focusing on the technical aspects of database management.

The video features a man in a white shirt standing against a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, resembling a digital or technological theme. The text "WRITING QUERIES" appears in the top left corner, accompanied by an orange cloud icon, while "JAKARTA EE" is displayed in the top right corner. The man gestures as he speaks, and the background transitions to show a white circle labeled "Entity Class" with an arrow pointing to the right, followed by the word "Data" and a series of horizontal lines. The text "SELECT <column_list>" then appears, followed by "FROM <table name>" and "WHERE <condition>;" in subsequent frames, indicating a step-by-step explanation of writing SQL queries. The man continues to gesture and speak throughout the video, emphasizing the instructional nature of the content.

The video features a man in a white shirt standing in front of a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, resembling a digital or technological theme. The background also includes logos and text related to "Jakarta EE" and "Writing Queries." The man appears to be explaining or presenting information about writing queries, specifically related to the Jakarta Persistence Query Language. Throughout the video, various pieces of text and code snippets are displayed on the screen, including examples of query syntax and the use of CriteriaBuilder. The man gestures with his hands, indicating he is actively engaged in explaining the content. The video transitions between different frames, showing changes in the text and code displayed, as well as the man's gestures and facial expressions, which suggest he is emphasizing certain points or concepts. The overall atmosphere is educational and focused on technology and programming.

The video features a man in a white sweater standing against a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, resembling a digital or technological theme. The text "SQL RESULT SET MAPPING" appears in the top left corner, accompanied by an orange cloud icon, while the "JAKARTA EE" logo is visible in the top right corner. The man gestures with his hands as he speaks, explaining the concept of SQL result set mapping. The background transitions to display a diagram with two orange circles labeled "Fields" and "Object," connected by an orange line, with the word "Queries" written in white. The diagram evolves to show the "Fields" circle multiplied by the "Object" circle, indicating a relationship between the two. The man continues to speak, and the background changes to display the text "@SqlResultSetMapping" in white, followed by a diagram illustrating the mapping process between two tables with green highlighted rows. The video concludes with the "JAKARTA EE" logo prominently displayed on a blue background, emphasizing the branding.

The video features a person standing in front of a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, resembling a digital or technological theme. The individual, dressed in a white long-sleeve shirt, appears to be explaining a concept related to Jakarta EE, as indicated by the logo and text displayed on the screen. The presentation begins with the title "Performing Updates & Deletes" and introduces the "Entity Manager" as a key component. The presenter gestures towards an orange box labeled "Set new Values," which is connected by an arrow to the "manager merge() method," leading to a "Modified Entity." The video then transitions to a new topic, "Generating," with the Jakarta EE logo prominently displayed, suggesting a continuation of the discussion on Jakarta EE functionalities. Throughout the video, the presenter maintains a professional demeanor, using hand gestures to emphasize points and engage the audience.

The video features a man in a white sweater standing in front of a blue background with a network of connected dots and lines, representing a digital or technological theme. The man appears to be explaining or presenting information related to Jakarta EE, as indicated by the logo in the top right corner. The presentation begins with a slide titled "GENERATING DATABASE SCHEMAS," displaying a code snippet and the Jakarta EE logo. The man gestures towards the screen, emphasizing the content. The scene transitions to a new slide titled "STORED PROCEDURES," showing a database icon with an arrow labeled "Execute" pointing to it, followed by a diagram illustrating the relationship between Jakarta Persistence, stored procedure queries, and databases. The man continues to speak, using hand gestures to highlight key points. The video concludes with a slide displaying the Jakarta Persistence logo and a URL link to the Jakarta EE specifications, with the man pointing towards the link, suggesting viewers visit the website for more information. Throughout the video, the background remains consistent, maintaining the digital theme with interconnected nodes and lines.
